content:
• Thursday, March 21, 2013
  • NKE

    After-hours top gainers, as of 6:00 p.m.: NKE +8%. PCC +7%. ANAC +5%. MU +4%. GMO +3%....

    After-hours top gainers, as of 6:00 p.m.: NKE +8%. PCC +7%. ANAC +5%. MU +4%. GMO +3%.
    After-hours top losers: NWY -18%. TIBX -14%. TECD -9%. SNMX -8%. EGHT -4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:33 PM | 2 Comments
  • TIBX

    Tibco (NASDAQ:TIBX) guides on its FQ1 call for FQ2 revenue of $242M-$252M and EPS of...

    Tibco (NASDAQ:TIBX) guides on its FQ1 call for FQ2 revenue of $242M-$252M and EPS of $0.17-$0.19, below a consensus of $264.8M and $0.26. As was the case following its FQ4 warning, the middleware/analytics software vendor suggests execution issues are playing a role in its troubles. Shares -14.7% AH. INFA -2.1%. TDC -1.4%. QLIK -2.1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:58 PM
  • ENTA

    Today's IPO of Enanta Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ENTA) closed +22.7% at $17.18 per share despite...

    Today's IPO of Enanta Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ENTA) closed +22.7% at $17.18 per share despite initially pricing 4M shares of its common stock at $14, the low-end of the expected $14-$16 range. JPMorgan and Credit Suisse acted as joint book-running managers for the IPO. Leerink Swann and JMP Securities were co-managers.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:55 PM
  • TECD

    Tech Data (NASDAQ:TECD) has resumed trading following its earnings restatement disclosure....

    Tech Data (NASDAQ:TECD) has resumed trading following its earnings restatement disclosure. Shares -10.7% AH to $44.25. The IT distributor's 52-week low is $42.25.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:09 PM | 1 Comment
  • MNST

    Monster (NASDAQ:MNST) -2.7% AH after Bloomberg reports of a fresh study (presented today at an...

    Monster (NASDAQ:MNST) -2.7% AH after Bloomberg reports of a fresh study (presented today at an American Heart Association meeting) indicating energy drinks can raise blood pressure and produce an irregular heartbeat. The study's lead author suggests those with pre-existing heart conditions drink cautiously. Monster is no stranger to seeing its shares hit by health-related controversies.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:50 PM | 4 Comments
  • EGHT

    8x8 (NASDAQ:EGHT) -4.2% AH after filing a $250M mixed securities shelf. The VoIP/unified...

    8x8 (NASDAQ:EGHT) -4.2% AH after filing a $250M mixed securities shelf. The VoIP/unified communications service provider only says it will use the proceeds "for working capital and other general corporate purposes." (S-3)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:42 PM
  • ILMN

    Illumina (NASDAQ:ILMN) wins a favorable judgment in its patent litigation against Life...

    Illumina (NASDAQ:ILMN) wins a favorable judgment in its patent litigation against Life Technologies (NASDAQ:LIFE), with the court saying that its sequencing systems do not infringe on LIFE's patents. Life Technologies filed the lawsuit against ILMN in 2009. The Court ruled that, “Life Tech cannot establish, as a matter of law, that the accused Illumina systems infringe” the patents. ILMN +1.4% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:33 PM
  • TIBX

    TIBCO Software (NASDAQ:TIBX): FQ1 EPS of $0.18 in-line. Revenue of $237.8M misses by $4.66M....

    TIBCO Software (NASDAQ:TIBX): FQ1 EPS of $0.18 in-line. Revenue of $237.8M misses by $4.66M. Shares -9.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:27 PM | 1 Comment
  • NKE

    Nike (NYSE:NKE): FQ1 EPS of $0.73 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $6.2B (+9% Y/Y) misses by $0.04B....

    Nike (NYSE:NKE): FQ1 EPS of $0.73 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $6.2B (+9% Y/Y) misses by $0.04B. Shares +5.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:16 PM | 3 Comments
  • RUE

    rue21 (NASDAQ:RUE): Q4 EPS of $0.65 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $269.1M (+22.4% Y/Y) misses by...

    rue21 (NASDAQ:RUE): Q4 EPS of $0.65 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $269.1M (+22.4% Y/Y) misses by $1.39M. Shares -1.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:10 PM
  • MU

    Micron (NASDAQ:MU): FQ2 EPS of -$0.28 misses by $0.09. Revenue of $2.1B beats by $0.18B. Shares...

    Micron (NASDAQ:MU): FQ2 EPS of -$0.28 misses by $0.09. Revenue of $2.1B beats by $0.18B. Shares +5.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:07 PM | 2 Comments
  • ANAC

    Anacor Pharmaceuticals (ANAC +26.5%) soars today after the company said earlier that Phase 2...

    Anacor Pharmaceuticals (ANAC +26.5%) soars today after the company said earlier that Phase 2 study results showed its AN2728 ointment reduced skin lesions in adolescents with atopic dermatitis, with 57 of the 86 patients between the ages of 12 to 17 years old showing complete or partial improvement compared to a standard baseline.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:03 PM
  • FSYS

    Fuel Systems Solutions (FSYS +8.4%) shares are soaring today amid heavy volume on no apparent...

    Fuel Systems Solutions (FSYS +8.4%) shares are soaring today amid heavy volume on no apparent news, while other natural gas vehicle plays all trade lower: WPRT -3.4%, CLNE -2.1%, NAV -2.8%, CMI -1.9%.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 PM | 6 Comments
  • LNG

    Barclays resumes coverage of Cheniere Energy (LNG +2.1%) at Overweight with a raised $28 target...

    Barclays resumes coverage of Cheniere Energy (LNG +2.1%) at Overweight with a raised $28 target price; shares hit a 52-week high today. The firm also resumes Cheniere Energy Partners (CQP +0.6%) at Equal Weight and a $26 target. The firm notes funding is still needed for the Creole Trail pipeline dropdown, part of which could come from equity issuance.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:46 PM | 3 Comments
  • ACAD

    Acadia Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ACAD) continues to soar, now up over 27% after saying its drug...

    Acadia Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ACAD) continues to soar, now up over 27% after saying its drug candidate Pimavanserin worked very well reducing hallucinations and delusions related to Parkinson's Disease during Phase III testing.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:43 PM | 1 Comment
  • SVU

    Supervalu (SVU +13%) reverses early losses after closing the Cerberus-led deal to reduce its...

    Supervalu (SVU +13%) reverses early losses after closing the Cerberus-led deal to reduce its supermarket portfolio and strengthen its balance sheet. Cantor Fitzgerald notes proceeds from share issue will be used for debt reduction, offsetting any significant dilution, and cheers the "end of a long period of value destruction."

     
     
     
     
    | 3:26 PM
  • AJRD

    GenCorp (GY +3.7%) trades up today after Oppenheimer intiated the shares with an Outperform and...

    GenCorp (GY +3.7%) trades up today after Oppenheimer intiated the shares with an Outperform and a $20 price target this morning. Oppenheimer says the stock has one of the more favorable growth profiles in the defense industry, and with an impressive 2014E 24% FCF yield ex-land, a highly valued land bank and a company-transforming acquisition about to close, it's attractive at current levels.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:14 PM
  • PERY

    Perry Ellis (NASDAQ:PERY) redeems itself with a 13% jump in revenue in Q4, sending shares +6.3%....

    Perry Ellis (NASDAQ:PERY) redeems itself with a 13% jump in revenue in Q4, sending shares +6.3%. "We believe the pieces are in place for a return to prominence," Brean Capital says in a post-earnings note - an about face from a February report that called PERY "at best dead money" through Q1 earnings in May.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:13 PM
  • CLR

    Investors fear Harold Hamm's contentious divorce could lead to a record financial settlement -...

    Investors fear Harold Hamm's contentious divorce could lead to a record financial settlement - he's worth an estimated $11.3B - and threaten his control of fast-growing Continental Resources (CLR -2.8%). Under Oklahoma family law, wealth accrued through the efforts of either spouse during a marriage would typically be subject to "equitable distribution" between the parties.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:07 PM | 4 Comments
  • SN

    Investors may be coming around to Sanchez Energy (SN +2.5%) CEO Tony Sanchez's declaration to...

    Investors may be coming around to Sanchez Energy (SN +2.5%) CEO Tony Sanchez's declaration to Jim Cramer that the recent acquisition of 43K Eagle Ford acres would be "transformational" for the company, as shares have slowly picked up steam during the week. For his part, Cramer thinks SN got "a great deal" which makes it a major Eagle Ford player.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:51 PM | 1 Comment
  • BODY

    Body Central (OTCQB:BODY +3.8%) rallies after Doughtery & Company steps in with a Buy rating...

    Body Central (OTCQB:BODY +3.8%) rallies after Doughtery & Company steps in with a Buy rating on shares. Valuation on the retailer looks intriguing to the investment firm.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:49 PM
  • KBH

    KB Home (KBH +1.9%) gains today after its FQ1 easily beat estimates on a 59% jump in total...

    KB Home (KBH +1.9%) gains today after its FQ1 easily beat estimates on a 59% jump in total revenue. Net losses narrowed as the home builder recorded strong revenue and margin growth, while prices, deliveries and orders also climbed. CEO Jeffrey Mezger notes that revenue growth was driven by both higher deliveries and increased pricing power, reflecting the company's land repositioning initiatives and a shift in consumer demand to larger homes.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:46 PM
  • ACTG

    Acacia Research (ACTG +4.1%) jumps after disclosing it has settled an infringement suit against...

    Acacia Research (ACTG +4.1%) jumps after disclosing it has settled an infringement suit against Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) that was pending in a court for the Eastern District of Texas. In January, Acacia settled a suit against Apple that was pending in the Northern District of Texas. Also, the company announced this morning it has reached a settlement and license agreement with Micron.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:25 PM
  • VIAV

    Telecom equipment/optical component names underperform following FBR's Cisco/Juniper downgrades,...

    Telecom equipment/optical component names underperform following FBR's Cisco/Juniper downgrades, as investors mull the impact of lower demand for switches/routers among service providers and enterprises on demand for complementary hardware and the parts that go into it. Given software-defined networking (the main reason for FBR's downgrade) will have a limited impact on hardware use on many carrier networks, is the Street overreacting? JDSU -4.2%. FNSR -3.3%. CIEN -3.8%. ADTN -3.1%. ALU -2.7%. ADTN -3.1%. SONS -4.7%. INFN -2.6%. FFIV -2.3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:14 PM
  • CLR

    Continental Resources (CLR -3.1%) shares are under pressure after Chairman and CEO Harold Hamm...

    Continental Resources (CLR -3.1%) shares are under pressure after Chairman and CEO Harold Hamm confirms a pending divorce, even as CLR says the divorce "has not and is not anticipated to have" any impact on the company's business or operations.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:02 PM | 8 Comments
  • MOV

    Shares of Movado (MOV -7.8%) get tripped up by profit guidance from the watch company which came...

    Shares of Movado (MOV -7.8%) get tripped up by profit guidance from the watch company which came in on the disappointing side. Weak data on Swiss watch exports to Asia could also be helping to tip sentiment.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:39 PM
  • MLHR

    Shares of Herman Miller (MLHR +7.5%) ride higher after the company beats profit estimates for...

    Shares of Herman Miller (MLHR +7.5%) ride higher after the company beats profit estimates for FQ3. Though sales and orders fell off from last quarter, the company notes it was due to seasonal patterns. Of note, the acquisition of the POSH business is starting to pay dividends as it helps Herman Miller develop its global business.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:34 PM
  • ACAD

    Midday top 10 gainers: ACAD +29%. CMT +19%. EGLE +17%. ANAC +17%. DRAM +18%. HNR +14%. ECT +14%....

    Midday top 10 gainers: ACAD +29%. CMT +19%. EGLE +17%. ANAC +17%. DRAM +18%. HNR +14%. ECT +14%. OTC:AFFY +13%. NICK +13%. GNK +12%.
    Midday top 10 losers: GMO -18%. BLDP -18%. AMBT -15%. SCHL -15%. CIMT -13%. AQ-OLD -13%. CHRM -12%. VTNR -11%. PSUN -10%. CSUN -9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:57 PM
  • TMO

    Life Technologies (LIFE -1.2%) slips after Cowen cut the shares from Outperform to Neutral on...

    Life Technologies (LIFE -1.2%) slips after Cowen cut the shares from Outperform to Neutral on valuation. The stock closed at $65.27 yesterday, hitting a new 52 week high just before the close.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:11 PM
  • CLF

    Cliffs Natural Resources (CLF +2%) investors will take what they can get, as shares move up on...

    Cliffs Natural Resources (CLF +2%) investors will take what they can get, as shares move up on takeover chatter apparently stoked by buzz on StockTwits and other sites. But the stock has been in a persistent downtrend, and today's move does little to fix it. CLF was the subject of a pessimistic note from Goldman two days ago which reiterated its Sell rating and cut its price target to $20.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:10 PM
  • SAP

    SAP's (SAP -2.1%) board recommends a regular dividend of €0.85/share ($1.10/share) for...

    SAP's (SAP -2.1%) board recommends a regular dividend of €0.85/share ($1.10/share) for FY12. SAP paid a regular dividend of €0.75/share and a special dividend of €0.35/share for FY11. The proposal translates into a yield of 1% and a payout ratio of 36%. Shares are trading lower today in sympathy with archrival Oracle.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:52 AM

  • Down sharply not long ago, a bit of green creeps into European indexes with a reported plan to...

    Down sharply not long ago, a bit of green creeps into European indexes with a reported plan to shut down Cyprus' Popular Bank and break it up into good and bad banks, as well as the split of Laiki Bank making the rounds. All deposits under €100K would reportedly be guaranteed. Italy (EWI) goes positive, as does the euro (FXE). The Stoxx 50 (FEZ) cuts its loss to 0.6%, the S&P (SPY) now down just 0.3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:50 AM
  • ORCL

    Evercore and CLSA have downgraded Oracle (ORCL -8.8%) following its FQ3 miss and light top-line...

    Evercore and CLSA have downgraded Oracle (ORCL -8.8%) following its FQ3 miss and light top-line guidance. The numbers have many worried about the impact of cloud apps ... and not just on application software sales. "As customers move to the cloud, you get a lot of the functionality consolidated ... so you need less hardware and less databases and middleware," says Pac Crest. UBS is still bullish: "Historically when they have a miss it’s a great time to buy." Interestingly, cloud rivals are higher - WDAY +1.4%, CRM +0.4%, N +1.2% - even as other peers follow the tech sector lower. IBM -1.6%. INFA -1.6%. RHT -1.1%. (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:39 AM | 4 Comments
  • CRTX

    Cornerstone Therapeutics (CRTX -2.8%) says it's retained Lazard to act as its independent...

    Cornerstone Therapeutics (CRTX -2.8%) says it's retained Lazard to act as its independent financial advisor and Clifford Chance to act as its independent legal counsel to assist the Special Committee in considering purchasing the company's common stock that it does not already own for a cash price of between $6.40 and $6.70 per share.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:23 AM
  • EA

    Longbow upgrades Electronic Arts (EA +2.9%) to Buy just two days after shares tumbled due to the...

    Longbow upgrades Electronic Arts (EA +2.9%) to Buy just two days after shares tumbled due to the FQ4 warning accompanying John Riccitiello's departure. Rival Take-Two (TTWO +1.7%) is also rallying.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:21 AM
  • BMC

    BMC Software (BMC +5.2%) jumps on a report P-E firms KKR and TPG have joined forces to make a...

    BMC Software (BMC +5.2%) jumps on a report P-E firms KKR and TPG have joined forces to make a possible bid. The systems management software firm has been the subject of buyout rumors for months.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:14 AM
  • FNMA

    From John Hempton's lips to the market's ears. The "just insane" bidding up of the almost...

    From John Hempton's lips to the market's ears. The "just insane" bidding up of the almost certainly worthless common stock of Fannie and Freddie (OTCQB:FNMA, FMCC.PB) savagely reverses, with both falling more than 50% within minutes.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:11 AM | 3 Comments
  • IAG

    IAMGOLD (IAG +3.7%) announces the startup of the Westwood gold processing plant in Quebec, which...

    IAMGOLD (IAG +3.7%) announces the startup of the Westwood gold processing plant in Quebec, which is expected to produce ~140K oz. of gold in 2013. IAG also provides a breakdown "on how [it] can achieve and potentially exceed" its $100M 2013 cost reduction program.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:59 AM
  • MATN

    OXiGENE (OXGN +4%) bucks a weak tape to trade higher today, after announcing late yesterday that...

    OXiGENE (OXGN +4%) bucks a weak tape to trade higher today, after announcing late yesterday that it's been issued a patent by the USPTO covering certain benzosuberene-based compounds, including the analogues referred to as KGP18 and KGP156 that the company is currently developing in the preclinical stage. The patent also covers methods of using those compounds to reduce blood flow to a tumor, and possibly restrain, slow, stop or reverse tumor progression.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:55 AM
  • EGLE

    Shipping stocks are on fire as the sector keeps up its volatile ways. A reading on China...

    Shipping stocks are on fire as the sector keeps up its volatile ways. A reading on China manufacturing that came in above expectations is helping to tip sentiment on the outlook for dry bulk shipping. Advancers: EGLE +12.4%, PRGN +5.1%, NEWL +7.4%, DRYS +2.7%, GNK +11.1%, EXM +16.3%, SHIP +6.6%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:49 AM | 1 Comment
  • GEVO

    Gevo (GEVO +7.9%) confirms a judgment of non-infringement will be entered as Butamax Advanced...

    Gevo (GEVO +7.9%) confirms a judgment of non-infringement will be entered as Butamax Advanced Biofuels (DD, BP) acknowledges Gevo does not infringe Butamax's asserted patents following winning an important court ruling earlier this week; as a result, the trial scheduled for April will no longer take place.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:31 AM
  • AIQUF

    Airgas' (ARG -5%) Q4 sales and profit warning is dragging a few peers down with it this morning:...

    Airgas' (ARG -5%) Q4 sales and profit warning is dragging a few peers down with it this morning: Air Products (APD -2%), Praxair (PX -1.4%), Sinopec Shanghai Petrochemical (SHI -1.4%), L'Air Liquide (OTCPK:AIQUY -3.3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:29 AM | 2 Comments
  • LULU

    Heard during Lululemon's (NASDAQ:LULU) earnings call: 1) CEO Christine Day says the company is...

    Heard during Lululemon's (NASDAQ:LULU) earnings call: 1) CEO Christine Day says the company is still trying to determine the exact cause of the "too-sheer" luon pants issue, but thinks it's a one-time, one-product occurrence. 2) The impact on Q1 is estimated to be a 500bps gross margin hit and a $12M-$17M reduction on revenue. 3) The retailer's announcement that it's moving into golf apparel may create the biggest buzz from the call. Shares of Lululemon are up 1% with the visibility on the yoga pants issue cleared up a bit. (webcast)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:16 AM | 2 Comments
  • FNMA

    Fannie Mae (OTCQB:FNMA +31.5%) and Freddie Mac (OTCQB:FMCC +26.9%) continue a torrid run, now...

    Fannie Mae (OTCQB:FNMA +31.5%) and Freddie Mac (OTCQB:FMCC +26.9%) continue a torrid run, now closing in on quadrupling this week. Buy the stocks for a trade, but the idea there is any value at all in the common when it's likely the preferred may even be worthless is "just insane," says John Hempton (an owner of the preferred).

     
     
     
     
    | 10:11 AM | 7 Comments
  • GES

    Guess (GES -5.3%) looks like an interesting LBO candidate with its clean balance sheet and...

    Guess (GES -5.3%) looks like an interesting LBO candidate with its clean balance sheet and strong cash flow, notes dealReporter. CEO Paul Marciano and his brother own close to 30% of the company giving them enough firepower to explore private options.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:59 AM
  • APPCQ

    Shares of American Apparel (APP +5.6%) jet higher after Standpoint Research upgrades the company...

    Shares of American Apparel (APP +5.6%) jet higher after Standpoint Research upgrades the company to a Buy rating.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:53 AM
  • PRKR

    ParkerVision (OTC:PRKR +2.6%) rallies to $3.54 after announcing its stock offering features 4.1M...

    ParkerVision (OTC:PRKR +2.6%) rallies to $3.54 after announcing its stock offering features 4.1M shares priced at $3.25. The offering will increase ParkerVision's share count by 4.9%, which is probably less than some investors feared. Net proceeds will total $12.4M. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:48 AM
  • ITMN

    The U.K.'s NICE health regulator has recommended that InterMune's (ITMN +10.6%) Esbriet therapy...

    The U.K.'s NICE health regulator has recommended that InterMune's (ITMN +10.6%) Esbriet therapy be used to treat mild-to-moderate idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis (IPF), of which there are 6,100-9,500 sufferers in England and Wales. IPF is a fatal lung disease. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:27 AM
  • BLDP

    Ballard Power (NASDAQ:BLDP) -13.2% premarket after announcing a public offering of 7.275M common...

    Ballard Power (NASDAQ:BLDP) -13.2% premarket after announcing a public offering of 7.275M common units at $1.10/unit. BLDP says net proceeds will be used for general corporate purposes.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:18 AM

  • Market preview: Stock futures are running either side of zero, although that's not too bad given...

    Market preview: Stock futures are running either side of zero, although that's not too bad given that Europe's solidly red following rather poor PMI data and as the crisis in Cyprus seems to gain strength. The S&P Mini is +0.1%. Oracle loses 7.5% and Scholastic slumps 11% following earnings reports.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
  • SVU

    Supervalue (NYSE:SVU) announces it completed the sale of five of its grocery store chains to a...

    Supervalue (NYSE:SVU) announces it completed the sale of five of its grocery store chains to a consortium led by Cerberus for a cool $3.3B. As part of the deal, Symphony Investors completed a tender offer for 11.686M shares at $4.00 a pop. After all the dust settles, Symphony Investors will hold a 21.2% stake in the trimmed-down Supervalu. SVU -2.2% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:14 AM
  • ITMN

    Premarket gainers: ITMN +12%. CBLI +9%. ACAD +7%. OTC:AFFY +6%.Losers: CIMT -12%. SCHL -11%....

    Premarket gainers: ITMN +12%. CBLI +9%. ACAD +7%. OTC:AFFY +6%.
    Losers: CIMT -12%. SCHL -11%. BLDP -9%. ORCL -8%. GES -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM
  • ZUMZ

    Ascendiant Capital Market launches coverage on Zumiez (NASDAQ:ZUMZ) with a Buy rating and $30...

    Ascendiant Capital Market launches coverage on Zumiez (NASDAQ:ZUMZ) with a Buy rating and $30 price target. ZUMZ +0.9% premarket to $24.00.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:05 AM
  • AIQUF

    Airgas (ARG) -3.5% premarket after warning that weaker than expected sales suggest it may miss...

    Airgas (ARG) -3.5% premarket after warning that weaker than expected sales suggest it may miss the low end of adjusted EPS guidance of $1.18 by ~4%. The quarter's organic sales growth through February was flat Y/Y and 2%-3% behind guidance, and March sales so far "have not improved appreciably" over February.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:39 AM
  • KBH

    KB Home (NYSE:KBH): FQ1 EPS of -$0.16 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $405.2M (+59% Y/Y) beats by...

    KB Home (NYSE:KBH): FQ1 EPS of -$0.16 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $405.2M (+59% Y/Y) beats by $45.4M. Shares +3% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:37 AM
  • ACAD

    Acadia (NASDAQ:ACAD) +6.4% after saying that its Pimavanserin performed well in a Phase III...

    Acadia (NASDAQ:ACAD) +6.4% after saying that its Pimavanserin performed well in a Phase III trial, showing a "robust and consistent efficacy...across a wide array of study measures" and confirming previous "positive top-line results." Twice as many patients treated with pimavanserin were rated as "very much improved or much improved" vs those given a placebo. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:31 AM
  • CSCO

    Cisco (NASDAQ:CSCO) is downgraded to Sell at FBR Capital, which says the company will find it...

    Cisco (NASDAQ:CSCO) is downgraded to Sell at FBR Capital, which says the company will find it difficult to offset weakening router and switching demand. Negative tech trends "could significantly blur the lines between routers, switches, AND servers." FBR throws in a downgrade of Juniper Networks (NYSE:JNPR) as well. Both are down more than 1% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:17 AM | 7 Comments
  • ISRG

    Intuitive Surgical (NASDAQ:ISRG) has increased its stock repurchase program by $1B, bringing the...

    Intuitive Surgical (NASDAQ:ISRG) has increased its stock repurchase program by $1B, bringing the total plan to $1.21B. The move comes after concerns were raised this month about the cost-benefit of using robotic devices for hysterectomy procedures. Shares +3.45%. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 7:50 AM | 1 Comment
  • LULU

    More on Lululemon (NASDAQ:LULU): For Q1, the retailer sees EPS of $0.28-$0.30 vs. $0.40...

    More on Lululemon (NASDAQ:LULU): For Q1, the retailer sees EPS of $0.28-$0.30 vs. $0.40 consensus and revenue of $333M-$343M vs. $345M consensus. CEO Christine Day will address shortage of black luon pants during the retailer's earnings call scheduled for 9:00 AM EST. LULU -1.4% premarket. (webcast)

     
     
     
     
    | 7:38 AM

    Yahoo (YHOO) is upped to a Buy at Oppenheimer, which also raises its price target to $27 from...

    Yahoo (YHOO) is upped to a Buy at Oppenheimer, which also raises its price target to $27 from $22. The combination of Alibaba maybe pulling off an IPO valuing it at $77B and higher revenues from search mean the shares - currently at $22 - have value, says Oppenheimer. Stock's up 1.6% premarket.

  • European shares and the euro are lower following fairly depressing eurozone PMI data, with even...

    European shares and the euro are lower following fairly depressing eurozone PMI data, with even German manufacturing unexpectedly contracting this month. The continuing crisis in Cyprus also isn't helping, although a positive Chinese PMI reading and the Fed's commitment to continued easing is apparently limiting the losses. EU Stoxx 50 -0.6%, London -0.8%, Paris -0.9%, Frankfurt -0.9%, Milan -0.3%, Madrid -0.3%. Euro -0.2% vs the dollar.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:21 AM | 5 Comments

  • Japanese stocks lead some Asian bourses higher as new BOJ governor Haruhiko Kuroda begins his...

    Japanese stocks lead some Asian bourses higher as new BOJ governor Haruhiko Kuroda begins his first day in his new job, while Chinese shares get a bit of support from an increase in PMI data. Ben Bernanke's pledge to continue QE is also helping the mood. Japan +1.3%, Hong Kong -0.1%, China +0.3%, India -0.2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:59 AM

  • Flash German manufacturing PMI unexpectedly drops to 48.9 from 50.3 in February; manufacturing...

    Flash German manufacturing PMI unexpectedly drops to 48.9 from 50.3 in February; manufacturing output 49.8 vs 50.7; services 51.6 vs 54.7, composite output 51 vs 53.3. The loss of output growth momentum was the greatest since the middle of 2011, says Market, while the survey doesn't take into account the impact of the Cyprus flair-up. The Dax and euro dive, and are -0.7% and -0.3% (vs the dollar) respectively. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:41 AM
